title: Is it safe to delete a copy or a link to the Inbox folder when it is in a subfolder?
content:
Hello,

Somehow a copy of the Inbox folder is in a sub folder where it causes a recursion problem.

Maybe it is a link, because the right click menu does not have "delete" as an option.

The unread count in the Inbox in the folder is less than the top level inbox.

Is it safe to delete?

Thanks

>Luke
creator: ledt

title: Perdida de todos los mensajes en thunderbird
content: Veia como se me iban borrando mensajes actuales y pasados y tuve que cerrar thunderbird para salvar los ultimos mensajes. Alguno solución para cuando le pase a otros? Muchas gracias
creator: alldayround

title: Internetudbyder siger at porte skal ændres, men så virker mail ikke
content:
Vore internetudbyder skriver, at portene til indgående og udgående mails skal ændres til henholdsvis port 995, i stedet for 110 (da denne bliver lukket) og udgående til 465. Dette gjorde vi på computeren (mozilla thunderbird), og herefter kan der hverken modtages eller sendes mails. Sættes indstillingerne tilbage, virker det igen. Dette er dog ikke holdtbart, da internetudbyderen (Yousee) har meddelt at mailen vil blive spærret, såfremt portene ikke ændres.

Har nogen stødt på samme problem, eller ved hvad der går galt i procssen? Yousee siger at det er de rigtige oplysninger de har givet, og at problemet må ligge ved Thunderbird/apple.
creator: ib.aaa

title: Setting a Default Start Time for Events
content:
When I create a new event on the calendar, the default behavior is to set it to start at the nearest half-hour to the current time, on whatever date I set. Is there a way to set a default time that events start at, rather than always setting them to start at the nearest half-hour?

Most of the events I'm creating start at a specific time that doesn't vary from event to event, and I'm very rarely creating them close to the time they're going to start. I've very nearly missed a couple of appointments because I didn't think to change the start time, and I've looked all over the Internet for a solution to this, to no avail (all of the results seem to be about setting a default appointment duration). Please help!
creator: sorayaprotera

title: 'Move to "Inbox" Again' option moves email to wrong inbox
content: I have multiple accounts set up in Thunderbird. I encountered this problem when I accidentally archived an email. I went to the archive folder for that account, found the email, right-clicked it and selected 'Move to "Inbox" Again'. However the email was moved to an inbox of a different account than it originally belonged to.
creator: alonshoer

title: profile update disaster!
content:
Thunderbird auto updated last night and wiped out my profiles. I need to get my old profiles back to access all my email accounts, address books etc. How???

Also how do I stop TB from doing auto updates!

This is very poor update control. You cannot wipe out users like this. I am looking to drop Thunderbird. I cannot afford to spend so much time reconstructing data that Thunderbird messed up.
creator: peterdev

title: Can't send email
content: My email comes to Thunderbird from my comcast.net account. I had to change my comcast password and ever since, I can receive mail in Thunderbird, but not send mail. I did enter the new password on the screen that came up, but that doesn't help
creator: sonorasue
